identity.name: E1
identity.mission: Create a tactical, high-stakes security dashboard that feels like a movie-grade SOC (Security Operations Center) interface.
principles: Fusion over Imitation: Mix 'Military HUD' precision with 'Cyberpunk' aesthetics.
Emotion First: The user should feel 'Protected' and 'Alert'.
Content is King: Data is the hero. Every pixel must convey status.
Contrast: High contrast is non-negotiable for readability in dark mode.

mono.usage: All data points, IP addresses, logs, and timestamps.

buttons.primary: bg-primary text-primary-foreground hover:bg-primary/90 rounded-sm font-mono uppercase tracking-wider text-xs
buttons.secondary: bg-secondary/10 text-secondary hover:bg-secondary/20 border border-secondary/20 rounded-sm font-mono uppercase tracking-wider text-xs

textures: Subtle noise overlay (opacity 0.03) on the main background.
effects: Glow: Drop shadow with color on active elements (e.g., shadow-[0_0_15px_rgba(239,68,68,0.5)] for threats).
Glitch: On the main logo or critical alert headers.

assets.icons: Lucide React (default) or Phosphor Icons (if available)

images.description: Abstract digital wires, use for Network Monitor background with low opacity overlay.
Dark monitor with code, use for Threat Analysis or Logs section background.

instructions_to_main_agent.general: Build a single-page application (SPA) dashboard. Use React Router if multiple views are strictly necessary, but a dense single-view dashboard is preferred for 'Command Center' feel.
layout_structure: Header: Logo (Glitch effect), System Status (Global Defcon level), User Profile.
- Col 1 (Left, Narrow): Navigation/Sidebar (Icons only on mobile, expanded on desktop).
- Row 1: Key Metrics (Threats Blocked, Active Connections, System Health).
- Row 2: Main Visual (Network Map or Live Traffic Graph).
- Row 1: AI Analysis Panel (Radar Chart + Text).
- Row 3: Quick Actions (Scan Now, Update Signatures).
specific_components: Use 'Recharts' for the Network Traffic graph (Line chart) and Threat Distribution (Donut chart).
Use 'Sonner' for toast notifications (e.g., 'Scan Complete', 'Threat Detected').
Use 'Lucide-React' icons: ShieldAlert, Activity, Network, Terminal, History, Settings.
Implement a 'Fake' scanning sequence when 'Scan Now' is clicked: Show a progress bar, cycle through random file names, then show results.

do_not: Do NOT use gradients for text.
Do NOT use rounded corners > 4px (keep it sharp/tactical).
Do NOT use generic 'Lorem Ipsum' - use realistic security jargon (e.g., 'Trojan.Win32.Generic', 'Suspicious outbound traffic to port 4444').
must: MUST use 'data-testid' on all interactive elements.
MUST ensure high contrast for text.
MUST make the dashboard responsive (stack columns on mobile).
